intro: Ficinia trollii, commonly known as the troll's fig, is a unique plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by edible fruits resembling tiny figs. Its adaptations to harsh environments include thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss and aid in capturing moisture from the air. Ficinia trollii is of interest to botanists due to its specialized morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
